definition.name: Cameron_Martin_space
definition.definition: The Cameron-Martin space of the massive GFF mu_0 on T^3 with covariance C = (-Delta + m^2)^{-1} is the Sobolev space H^1(T^3) with norm ||h||^2 = <h, (-Delta+m^2)h>_{L^2}. Smooth functions C^inf(T^3) are contained in H^1(T^3). The Cameron-Martin theorem states: for h in H^1, the shifted measure T_h* mu_0 is equivalent to mu_0 with explicit RN derivative exp(<(-Delta+m^2)h, phi> - (1/2)||h||^2_{H^1}).
